channel.title: [More PHP]Making a auto generated Webpage?
channel.description:
I really need someone I could just go to for php help, instead of spamming topics in here lol <3 the web dev section. So here's the basics. My site has a Nav bar on the left side, Logo on top, and the mid/right is taken up with news feed (about 4 posts are shown at a time). Each post has a "read more" option to go further in depth on what the update is (Obvious RSPS is obvious). What I want to do, is make it so I don't need to jump in there, and edit the page for each update, and make new ones for the old updates, etc. So what I was thinking is I could create a login page, where there is only 1 user (i.e me) that has an account, and that would re-direct you to a form where you put in the Announcement name (i.e Server Maintenance for X hours), the date of the update (no explanation needed), the short description, and the extended description. The short description would be put on the main page (home page), and the extended description would be on the auto-generated news update article.
Anyone know how to go about doing this? Please and thankies. ;)

item.title: [More PHP]Making a auto generated Webpage?
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:469466”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=586667.msg4164978#msg4164978 date=1353597393]

I really need someone I could just go to for php help, instead of spamming topics in here lol <3 the web dev section.

Skype: aj.cordio
Or just private message me on here, I wouldn’t mind helping you with this.

I prefer people to post here than ask me directly, considering most of the website developers on moparscape reply to every new topic it’s always better to get more feedback :P.

If you have to contact me directly, Ruby_Website_Developer is my skype; I’m barely on tho. lol

Meh, I rather have them contact me personally. Because all of use Web Developers program differently. And if one of us tells the user to do it one way, and two other people try to correct that person by saying how they do it. We start to confuse the user… Heh
[/quote]
Programming styles are like assholes. Everybody’s got one and everyone thinks everyone else’s stinks.

There are lots of “news systems” on the web, make sure to look in to the code though so you can learn from it

Well then, that doesn’t teach me much does it? To ‘rip’ a persons code doesn’t teach you anything good.[/quote]
That’s why he stated to look into the code. Looking at a basic news script that someone made will help you get a better understanding of what certain things do (especially if the source has comments).

Note that I said basic. Looking at a well developed system that has numerous contributors and is based on OOP or MVC will not really help a new person learn much.

Read full topic

item.title: [More PHP]Making a auto generated Webpage?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

These are probably bad tutorials, but hopefully they give you the grasp of what is needed to be done, then you can simply read documentation on php.net

1stWebDesigner – 11 Dec 16

PHP vs Ruby vs Python: The Three Programming Languages in a Nutshell -...

There are lots programming languages out there, and each works to do specific and unique tasks. Each language has a unique set of keywords and special syntaxes for organizing program commands.


It Still Works

Internet | It Still Works

On the internet, nobody knows you are a dog. Get your internet on Lassie!


http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/242835-creating-a-simple-dynamic-website-with-php/

Read full topic

item.title: [More PHP]Making a auto generated Webpage?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:4, topic:469466”]Make a template.

<?php
 include_once('header.tpl.php'); //header
  //mysql crap
 include_once('footer.tpl.php'); //footer
?>

Query all the ‘news’ into a database, display them all on the homepage. When you click to edit, only load the single news item into the template.

Sorry for the piss-poor explanation.[/quote]
I hope you know, I’m like level .0001 on php.

Read full topic
